        Returns:
        HashMap of toy prototypes mapping from toy name to toy prototype.

      • newDayPetActions

        public void newDayPetActions(Pet pet)
        This runs just before a user interacts with their pet. It does two things: 1. Increases the pet's fatigue, decreases its happiness, increases its hunger, and increases its mischievousness. 2. If the pet is very tired, it decreases its health.
        Parameters:
        pet - The pet the player is about to interact with.

      • checkIfMisbehaving

        public java.lang.Boolean checkIfMisbehaving(Pet pet)
        Checks if the pet is misbehaving. The pet will misbehave if it is already misbehaving, or based on its wellness, which is a weighted combination of the pet's happiness, health, mischievousness, and hunger.
        Parameters:
        pet - The pet who might be misbehaving.
        Returns:
        Whether the pet is misbehaving.

      • checkIfSick

        public java.lang.Boolean checkIfSick(Pet pet)
        Checks if the pet is sick. The pet will be sick if: - the pet was already sick - the pet has health below 5% - the pet's hunger is 100%. It could also become sick randomly, if: - the pet has health below 25%, it has a 75% chance of becoming sick - the pet has health below 50%, it has a 50% chance of becoming sick - the pet has health below 75%, it has a 25% chance of becoming sick
        Parameters:
        pet - The pet who might be sick.
        Returns:
        Whether the pet is sick.

      • checkIfDead

        public java.lang.Boolean checkIfDead(Pet pet)
        Checks it the pet has died. The pet will die if: - the pet is sick and has happiness less than 50% - its health is less than 5% - its bladder is full - it is 100% tired - 50% chance of death if the bladder is more than 75% full - 15% chance of death if more than 75% tired - 1% chance of random death (hit by a car, etc.)
        Parameters:
        pet - The pet who might be dead.
        Returns:
        Whether the pet is dead.

      • rankPlayers

        public Player[] rankPlayers()
        Ranks players based on score in descending order of score. Assumes all scores have been calculated beforehand.
        Returns:
        ranked list of players.

      • addPlayers

        public void addPlayers(java.util.ArrayList<Player> playerArray)
        Method purely for testing purposes. Overwrites existing playerList with its own array of players.
        Parameters:
        playerArray - Fully setup list of players.

      • getNumDays

        public int getNumDays()
        Get the number of days the game will go on for.
        Returns:
        number of days game will run for.

      • getCurrentDay

        public int getCurrentDay()
        Get the current day number.
        Returns:
        current day.

      • createPlayer

        public void createPlayer(java.lang.String[] values)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new player and their pets.
        Parameters:
        values - String array of data to convert into pet objects. Array should be of form {"player name", "pet one name\npet one species", "pet two name\npet two species",...}
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Pet creation side effect.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - For an unknown pet type.

      • getPlayerList

        Returns:
        list of players

        Parameters:

        public void nextDay()
        Moves on to the next day.

      • initialisePlayer

        public void initialisePlayer(Player currentPlayer)
        Initialises a player's turn. It gives the player their daily allowance.
        Parameters:
        currentPlayer - Player getting initialised.
